thread.title: One Winner from the Italian Crisis? Denmark

author: Mischa Frankl-Duval
title: One Winner from the Italian Crisis? Denmark
text: Political uncertainty has roiled European markets this week. On Tuesday, short-dated government bonds in Italy endured their worst session since records began: 2-year notes spiked by more than 150 basis points, while yields on 2-year notes in Spain and Portugal rose 23 and 12 basis points respectively. But not all of Europe caught the bug: Danish bonds WSJ City PM: Europe's Banks Face an All Too Familiar Problem, What to Make of Italy's Bond Selloff Next More Than Meats the Eye
